note: Title from p. 5.|Text begins on p. 6.|Table of contents on p. 1-3.|Ms in naskh script on glazed and unglazed paper. Catchwords; some vocalization. Headings, overlinings and keywords in red ink. Front hinge is torn; cover edges are worn.|Paper comes from several sources; some leaves are glazed; others are not. Weight of leaves varies. Some discoloration and stains. physical_description: Extent: i, 140, i leaves : paper ; 240 x 168 (160 x 105) mm. bound to 243 x 170 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 140a).|The title also appears on the upper cover (almost illegible due to worm damage).|11 long lines per page . Written in medium small naskh using black ink. Light cream glazed paper with horizontal chain lines visible. The text is fully vocalized. Collation marks (see collation statement on fol. 140a [prev. 139a]). Several titles, ownership statements (the oldest legible dated 1003 H. [1594]), and one seal on fol. 1a. Kabīkaj on fol. i. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (between fol. 99 and 100, blank ; two fol. 63). Serious worm damage.|Collation: Paper, i (later flyleaf) + 140 leaves ; 112 (-1?) 28 3-410 58 6-810 98 108 (-1?) 11-1210 13-148 1512 ; quires numbered using Arabic ordinals in the form "al-khāmis min al-juzʾ al-rābiʻ" and signed on the last folio with the inscription "blgh" ; the corners of the leaves are often repaired, making the reconstruction of the quires uneasy, in particular for the beginning of the text. The first legible numbered quire is "al-khāmis min al-juzʾ al-rābiʻ" on fol. 20a [prev. 21a] ; catchword in a later hand on the verso of each leaf.|Copied by the Mamlūk al-Muʻaẓẓamī Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥusayn ibn Tamīm al-Tamīmī on 15 Ṣafar 624 in Damascus (colophon, fol. 140a).|Acquired from Murād Bey Bārūdī, Beirut, 1925.

physical_description: Extent: i, 286, i leaves: paper ; 193 x 165 (100 x 93) mm. bound to 200 x 175 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from lower edge of the text block.|13 lines per page. Written in clear medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Dark thick paper with pulp and chain lines visible. Important marginalia, with ḥāshiyah and short excerpts of other works. These continue after the end of the text on fol. 285b-286b (including a ṣalāt al-Ḥājah on fol. 285b). Fol i is a later addition on glazed european paper, with a grid in red ink on the verso. Kabīkaj, verses of poetry in Persian, inscriptions and short texts on fol. 1a. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Uṣūl 3" (repeated in pink pencil on the pastedown of the upper cover). Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 199".|From the books of Aḥmad Najīb ibn Aḥmad Ṭāhir (ownership statement on fol. 1a). Seal on fol. 286a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

Fol. 1 and 2a, and 222, are later additions on glazed European paper (fol. 1 "Tre Lune" ; fol. 2a pasted on the first original folio, now fol. 2b).|Origin: Copy completed by Khiḍr ibn Ramaḍān al-Arzan al-Rūmī [Erzurūmī] in 724 H. [1689 or 1690], with seal ; Aḥmad ibn ʻUthmān al-Arzan al-Rūmī [Erzurūmī], al-mushtahir bi-Penbe Zade, dated Muḥarram 1137 [Oct. 1724], with seal. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red for rubrication. On ff. 7b-9a text is within a frame outlined in gold ink. Fol. 7b has a simple head piece made with one scalloped line of gold ink, with radiating sprigs around the outer edges. Foliation in Arabic numerals in red ink and in Western numerals in pencil. Glazed European paper. Some marginal annotations throughout. Fol. 1b has a list of references to the Qurʼān. Ff. 2a-3b have a table of contents in black and red ink. Ff. 6b-7a contain two family trees of the Maḥbūbīs, and a short paragraph explaining their geneaology and their respective writings related to the original work of Marghīnānī. There are several short inscriptions on ff. 1a, 2a, 4a, and 5a, including a few lines of verse on fol. 5a.|An extended signature, including his ancestry, by Mawlānā Ḥāfiẓ al-Dīn al-Naḥāwī on fol. 1a.|A circular ownership seal in the name of ʻUmar al-Sayyid ʻAbduh on fol. 7a (three more ownership seals on same fol., illegible).|Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda.|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda.

author_as_recorded: Maḥbūbī, ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Masʻūd, -1346 or 1347
physical_description: Extent: 354 leaves : paper ; 182 x 110 (130 x 60) mm. bound to 182 x 115 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 1a.|Copy is dated J. 1002 (1594) -- colophon (fol. 353a).|19 lines per page. Written in small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red for rubrication. The text is within a gold leaf frame outlined in black ink. Fol. 5b has an illuminated head piece executed in gold leaf and dark blue watercolor. Foliation in Arabic numerals in red and black ink. Dark cream glazed paper with no chain or laid lines visible and with prominent fibres, except for a few sheets in the second half on the ms., which are a later replacement on a lighter glazed paper with visible laid lines. Extensive marginal annotation throughout, most heavily at the start, including several inserted slips, includes excerpts attributed to, among others, ʻImād Kāshī, Ibn Kamāl, Kamāl al-Dīn etc. Several short inscriptions on fol. 1b, and one on fol. 4a. Fol. 3a has the last page of a table of contents in black and red ink (the rest of the pages missing). Fol. 4b has Sūrat al-Fātiḥah, and fol. 5a has an extended title like paragraph explaining the relationship between the author Maḥbūbī and his grandfathers, and is signed Niẓām al-Dīn. Same fol. (fol. 5a) has an obliterated ownership signature and a seal, both almost completely illegible.|Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.

Sharḥ al-Wiqāyah|Islam--Customs and practices--Early works to 1800|Muslims--Conduct of life--Early works to 1800|Islamic law--Interpretation and construction--Early works to 1800|Hanafites--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
author_as_recorded: Maḥbūbī, ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Masʻūd, -1346 or 1347
physical_description: Extent: 363 leaves : paper ; 180 x 120 (110 x 53) mm. bound to 183 x 135 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by the cataloger.|The main text is written within a gold leaf frame outlined in black ink, and has 19 lines per page. It is in small naskh in black ink with use of red ink for underlined sections and gold ink for rubrication. Ff. 3b and 4a have illuminated head pieces executed in gold leaf and blue and red watercolors. Fol. 363a has a small illuminated tail piece of triangular shape with foliage motifs, executed in gold leaf with blue and red watercolors. The gloss is written around the frame of the main text, most of it clock-wise on the frame-ruled outer edge of the margins, but on some pages the space between the main text frame and the outer egde of the margins is also filled, where the text is written within set geometrical patterns in the shape of crossed triangles, and cypress trees on the top and the bottom of the text frame. The text of the gloss is written in very small naskh with use of red, and to a lesser extent gold, for rubrication. Dark cream glazed paper with visible laid lines. Some additional annotation added on inserted slips, chiefly at the start. Fol. 3a has an elegant small table of contents in gold and black, and several short inscriptions of a later date. It also has a very faint ownership seal. Fol. 1a has an ownership statement in the name of Hacı Ethem, dated 1283 (1866-67).|Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|Incipit: الحمد لله رب العالمين والصلوة والسلام على خير خليقة محمد وآله وصحبه الطيّبين الطاهرين قال الشيخ الامام الاجل حسام الدين عمر بن عبد العزيز البخارى نعمه الله اما بعد فانّ مشايخنا رحمهم الله كانوا يعظمون هذا الكتاب تعظيما ويقدمون على ساير الكتب|Explicit: ويصير من فروض الاعيان ولو اشترى بثمن مجهول معاين يسقط به حق الشفعة|Physical description: 13 lines per page. Written in black ink with use of red. Light cream paper with laid lines and pulp visible. Marginal and interlinear ḥāshiyah. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including a note on the number of leaves in the copy. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "116". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 944".|Origin: Copied by ʻAlī ibn ʻUthmān in Ramaḍān 873 (colophon, fol. 211b).|Ownership statement in the name of Aḥmad Najīb ibn Aḥmad Ṭāhir, dated Rabīʻ I [12]81[Aug.-Sept. 1864] on fol. 1a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Fatwas--History--12th century--Sources|Hanafites--History--12th century--Sources|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton|Hanafites--Histoire--12e siècle--Sources|Manuscrits arabes--New Jersey--Princeton|Fatwas|Hanafites|Manuscripts, Arabic|New Jersey--Princeton|1100-1199
physical_description: Extent: 344 leaves: paper ; 268 x 180 (195 x 135) mm. bound to 270 x 195 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from heading of second Table of contents (fol. 10a). The title appears in the beginning of the text as "Kitāb al-khulāṣah" (fol. 11b, l. 14).|Incipit: الحمد لله خالق الارواح والاجسام وجاعل النور والظلام ... قال الشيخ الامام الزاهد البارع فقيه الامة ظهير الشريعة محي السنة مقتدر الانام بقية الاسلاف الى الاخلاف كريم الاطراف افتخار الملة والدين ركن الاسلام فى العالمين طاهر بن احمد بن عبد الرشيد البخارى نوّر الله تربته واعّلى فى الجنان رتبته قد عرفتم اخواني ايّدكم الله تعالى ان العلوم كثيرة والاعمار قصيرة|Explicit: قال المصنف رحمه الله كانه اخذ بقول ابى حنيفة ... وتبطل الثاني لانه يمكنها ان يقول كلبهما الشفقة والخيار والله اعلم|Physical description: 29 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red. Thin cream paper, glossy, with laid lines and pulp visible. Some folios on European paper with watermark (see fol. 26). Fol. 1-5, 6-9, and 341-344 are latter additions on European paper with watermark, with a table of contents in black and red in a black grid on fol. 1-5, several short sayings and notes, including a biographical note on the author from Ṭabaqāt al-fuqahāʼ by [Ibn] Quṭlūbughā (fol. 6a), in several hands on fol. 6a-9b, and short fatwas and other inscriptions on fol. 341a-344b. Another table of contents mentioning only the titles of the Kitāb, apparently by the same hand as the main text appears on fol. 10a. Several short excerpts and inscriptions on fol. 10b-11a. Inscription in Ottoman Turkish on the pastedown of the upper cover.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Ḥ 239". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 950".|Origin: Copied by Amīr Maḥmūd ibn Ilyās ibn Amīr al-Khaṭīb in Qarah Warīd(?) on a Thursday of Muḥarram 882 [April-May, 1477] (colophon, fol. 340b).|Two ownership statements on fol. 11a, in the name of Luṭf al-Mudarris, from Dār al-Khilāfah, and of Sharīf Pāshā Zade Sayyid Muḥammad Asfahd(?), the latter dated Muḥarram 1307 [Sept. 1889]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 2 v. (217 + 230) leaves: paper ; 265 x 180 mm. bound to 270 x 190 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from vol. 1, fol. 3a (in the hand of Nūḥādī Zade, see provenance note). The same title appears on vol. 2, fol. 3a.|Incipit: الحمد لله خالق الارواح والاجسام وجاعل النور والظلام ... قال الشيخ الامام الزاهد البارع فقيه الامة ظهير الشريعة محي السنة مقتدى الانام بقية الاسلاف كريم الاطراف افتخار الملة والدين ركن الاسلام فى العالمين طاهر بن احمد بن عبد الرشيد البخارى نوّر الله تربته واعلى فى الجنان رتبته قد عرفتم اخوانى ايّدكم الله تعالى ان العلوم كثيرة والاعمار قصيرة|Explicit: قال رضى الله عنه كانه اخذ بقول ابى حنيفة ... فان اخضر فى تلك المدة قضى له والا ابطل شفقته والله تعالى اعلم بالصواب|Physical description: vol. 1 is written in small naskh with elements of taʻlīq in black ink with use of red for headings, overlining and re-inking, 27 lines per page (205 x 125 mm.), on European(?) paper. Vol. 2 is written in medium small square naskh in black ink with use of red, 29 lines per page (200 x 120 mm.), on thick soft cream paper, with laid lines and pulp visible, frame-ruled ; marginal annotations. Vol. 1, fol. 1-2 are later additions with a table of contents. Vol. 2, fol. 1-2 are later additions with the end of the first part (juzʼ) and a table of contents of the second part. Several inscriptions, some erased, on vol. 1, fol. 2b-3a. Inscription in Arabic numerals on the tail of the text block of each vol., reading respectively "1" and "2".|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover of each volume, reading respectively: "Thānī 275" and "Thānī 276".|Origin: Copy of vol. 2 completed on 2 Shaʻbān 86?7 [April 22, 1463] (colophon, vol. 2, fol. 229b). The fist vol. appears to be from a later date.|From the books of Aḥmad Nūr al-Dīn, known as Nūḥādī Zade (ownership statement, vol. 1, fol. 3a ; vol. 2, fol. 3a). Ownership statement in the name of Qāsim al-ʻUlwānī on vol. 2, fol. 3a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 301 leaves: paper ; 280 x 185 (160 x 105) mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from note on fol. 2a.|Physical description: 17 lines per page. Written in small casual nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Cream paper with laid and chain lines visible (a few leaves are dyed in orange). Fol. 1 is a latter addition on European paper. Marginal annotations (important on the first folios). Table of contents on fol. 1b. Several inscriptions and short excerpts, including an erased ownership statement on fol. 2a. Several prayers and sayings from the Prophet on fol. 297b-298b. Fol. 299: Blank. Foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals.|Origin: Copy completed on Sunday 21 Rabīʻ al-Awwal 833 [Dec. 18, 1429] (in numerals) by Yūsuf ibn Ibrāhīm (colophon, fol. 297b).|Collation: Paper, fol. 301 ; 110 (-1 at the beginning of the quire, +1 later added European paper) 2-2910 3010 (+1, last fol.) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Former shelfmark: Inscription in Arabic numerals on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "1640". Inscription in Arabic numerals on a spine label (vertical): "122".|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

author_as_recorded: Marghīnānī, ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr, -1196 or 1197
physical_description: Extent: i, 289, i leaves: paper ; 265 x 175 (190 x 105) mm. bound to 265 x 180 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 288b-289a).|Physical description: 21 lines per page. Written in small naskh with elements of taʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Thin light biscuit paper with pulp and laid lines visible. The first 4 fol. are later additions on European paper with watermark. Fol. 26-72, 158-173, and 214-235 in the modern foliation are later replacements. Important marginal annotations on the original leaves. Annotations on pieces of paper pasted between the leaves. The first six folios of the text (fol. 4-9 in the modern foliation in pencil) have the upper part mended, with the text recopied on the repair. Table of contents on fol. 3a-4a. Several inscriptions and short texts on fol. 5a. Foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits the first fol.).|Origin: Copy completed on Yawm al-Khamīs 10 Rabīʻ al-Ākhar 824 [April 1421] by Ṣadr al-Dīn ibn Sharaf al-Dīn ibn ʻAlāʼ al-qāḍī al-Wāshjhī (colophon, fol. 289a).|Former shelmark: Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Thānī 442". Inscription in Arabic numerals on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "1645".|Inscription by Ismāʻīl Ṣidqī in purple ink on fol. 4b and 5a, dated 1317 H. [1899 or 1900]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

author_as_recorded: Zāhidī al-Ghazmīnī, Mukhtār ibn Maḥmūd, -1259 or 1260
physical_description: Extent: 335 leaves: paper ; 273 x 178 (190 x 110) mm. bound to 275 x 180 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from preamble (fol. 10b, l. 23-24). The name of the author appears at the beginning of the text.|Physical description: 23 lines per page. Written in black and red ink. Headings in larger script with re-inking in red. Light biscuit paper with laid and chain lines and pulp visible. Marginal annotations. Fol. 1-8 and 333 [332 in the modern foliation] are later additions of glazed European paper with watermark, with a table of contents on fol. 1a-8a. Several short texts relating stories and fatwas on fol. 9a [8a in the modern foliation]. List of abbreviations used in the text on fol. 9b [8b]. Several inscriptions including ownership statements on fol. 10a [9a]. Magic formula on fol. 335b [334b]. Foliation in red ink using Arabic numerals (starts with "1" on fol. 11a [10a]). Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits the first fol.).|Three spine labels (vertical), one with a red border, with the title in Arabic script, reading "Qunyat al-munyah lil-Zāhidī" ; the scond bordered in blue, with the inscription in Roman script: "R3" (repeated on a similar label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover, and in red pencil on fol. 1a) ; the third almost completely wanting.|Origin: Copy completed in Rajab 823 [July-Aug. 1420] by Najm al-Jalālī(?) al-Bukhārī (colophon, fol. 333b [332b in the modern foliation]).|Several ownership statements, some with seals on fol. 10a [9a in the modern foliation]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 224a). Written in clear square medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for key words and overlinings. Headings in larger script in red ink. Light cream paper, glossy, with laid and chain lines visible ; frame-ruled. Marginal annotations. Partial table of contents on fol. 2a.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Thānī 223". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "321 Ḥāʼ".|Collation: Paper, fol. i, 225, i ; i (later added endpaper; European paper with watermark) 110 (+2, fol. 1-2) 2-2110 2210 (+ 3, after fol. 222) i (later added endpaper; European paper with watermark) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf ; the quires are numbered using Arabic ordinals in the form "thānī" (see fol. 13a ; often cut off due to the trimming of the pages).|Origin: Copy completed on Thursday 7 Rajab 850 [Sept. 28, 1446] by Muḥammad Shāh Ibn Abī Bakr al-Ḥamawī (colophon, fol. 224a).|Two ownership statements, each with a seal, on fol. 3a, in the name of Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn al-qāḍī in ... and of Qarwī(?) author_as_recorded_agr: مرغناني، عبد الرحيم بن ابي بكر
physical_description: Extent: ii + 324, ii leaves: paper ; 270 x 180 (205 x 140) mm. bound to 270 x 180 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from a note on fol. (i)a, repeated on fol. (ii)a and 1a. See GAL.|Incipit: بسم اله الرحمن الرحيم وباسمه يبتدأ كل كتاب ويختم وينثر كل خطاب وينظم وبالصلوة على رسوله ... وبعد فان العلم فخر يبقى على مرور الاحقاب|Explicit: وخطل الخاطر الضعيف الماثر نجزت كتابته فى اواخر شعبان لسنه احدي وخمسين وستمايه هجريه بالمدرسة الميمويه الاميريه الاحليه المعربيه(؟) عماد المله صا الدينيه المبنيه براوال سرووعك احدى محال البلده الفاخره سمرقند لا زالت معموره . اما بعد فان مسايل هذا الكتاب اعز من الوجوه الحسان واعز من اللالى والمرجان ... وقد كان تولى امر تحرير الكتاب ... الا انه اتفق الاتمام على يدي ابن مولفه جمال المله والدين برهان الائمه فى العالمين تغمده الله تعالى بالرحمة والرضوان واسكنه ... الجنان والله تعالى اعلم بالصواب واليه المرجع والماب|Physical description: 29 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines and pulp visible. Marginal annotations. Fol. i and ii are later additions in European paper with watermark. Fol. 1 consists of a leaf of the same paper pasted on the recto of an original folio. Fol. 9 is a later replacement in European paper with watermark. Inscription in Roman script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "32Y" (repeated in red pencil on fol. (i)a).|Origin: Copy completed on Thursday 15 Jumādá al-Ākhirah 858 [June 1454] (colophon, fol. 324a).|Several ownership statements, some with seals on fol. (i)a, (ii)b and 1a, in the name of Muḥammad ibn Ḥamzah al-Ḥusaynī al-Shāmī al-Ḥanafī (dated 109?6 H. [1684-5]) ; ʻAbd al-Karīm ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Sayyid Ḥamzah al-Ḥusaynī al-Ḥanafī ; Muḥammad Abū al-Ṣafā al-muftī bi-Dimashq al-Shām (dated end of Rabīʻ al-Ūlá, 25, 1119 [June 26, 1707] ; Muḥammad ibn Fatḥ ibn ʻAbd al-Wāḥid al-...? al-Ḥanafī (dated 1021 H. [1612-3]) ; Muḥammad Murād ibn Muḥammad al-SQāminī(?) thumma al-Ayyūbī al-Ḥanafī (dated end of Shaʻbān 1143 [March 1731]), etc. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 138 leaves: paper ; 180 x 135 (112 x 85) mm. bound to 180 x 135 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a). The second part of the title (after "al-baḥrayn") is written in a smaller script in red ink.|Physical description: 15 lines per page. Written in clear small square naskh in black ink with use of red for key-words and headings. Red teardrops in groups of three for text-stops. Thick cream paper, glossy, with pulp and chain lines visible. Fol. 3, 8, 55-56, 95-96, 115-116, 124-127 are later replacements. Quinions. Several inscriptions, including ownership statements, on fol. 1a (most of them obliterated).|Collation: Paper, fol. 138 ; 1-1310 1410 (-2, after fol. 138) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Inscription in Roman script in red pencil on the pastedown of the upper cover: "50 Aus Y".|Origin: Copy completed in Madīnat al-Quds, on Friday 15 Jumādá al-Ūlá 854 [June 26, 1450] by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Sūdānī al-Ḥanafī (colophon, fol. 137b).|Patronage: Copied for (bi-rasm) Muḥyī al-Dīn Yaḥyá al-Ḥanafī al-Maqdisī (colophon, fol. 137b).|Reading statement in the name of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ṭarābulusī al-Ḥanafī, disciple (tilmīdh) of al-Shaykh Burhān al-Dīn ibn ...? al-Ḥanafī (fol. 138b). On the same fol., ownership statement apparently by the same hand (Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-Ṭarābulusī al-Ḥanafī), with indication of a price, in Damascus. Several ownership statements on fol. 1a and 138a, most of them obliterated, one dated 3 Dhū al-Qaʻdah 1084 [Feb. 9, 1674] (fol. 138a). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 160 leaves: paper ; 183 x 130 (115 x 76) mm. bound to 185 x 140 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from illuminated title page (fol. 1a).|Physical description: 13 lines per page. Written in small square naskh in black ink with use of red for headings, re-inking, etc. The text is vocalized. Red teardrop text-stops. On the two first pages of the text (fol. 1b-2a), frame in gold outlined in black, with headings in gold thulth outlined in black. Illuminated title page in blue, red and gold on fol. 1a. Thick dark cream paper, opaque, with laid and chain lines, and pulp, visible ; frame-ruled (note the ruling for the ḥāshiyah). Fol. 160 is a later addition. Ḥāshiyah on the margins.|Origin: Copy completed on Wednesday 10 Dhū al-Qaʻdah 883 [Feb. 1479] by Muḥammad Abū al-Luṭf ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻImrān (colophon, fol. 159b). Collation statement on the margin of fol. 159b, stating that the text was collated on the copy of Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad Abū al-Jawd al-Ghazzī, known as Ibn al-Maghribī, itself collated on a copy written by Nāṣir al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Ayāsī, from an autograph copy.|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: i, 286, i leaves: paper ; 275 x 180 (220 x 135) mm. bound to 275 x 190 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|Incipit: يا من لا يحوط كماله كماله نطاق وصف الفصحاء ولا ينوط بادراكه افكار فحول الفضلاء نحمدك ... وبعد فيقول العبد الضعيف ... عبد اللطيف بن عبد العزيز بن امين الدين ختم الله بالخير عمله ... انّ بعض اخوانى وخلص خلانى فى اثنا الصحبة من البين قالوا ان مجمع البحرين كتاب بديع ... الحمد لله ابتدا المص فى اول تصنيفه بالتحميد اقتداء بكتاب الله الحميد ... [2أ] فكيف شانهم فى عصرنا المملوّ بالشرار|Explicit: واجازها محمد حملا لكلامه اى الصرف الى مصالحه تصحيحا له هذا آخر الكلام الحمد لله على التمام ولرسوله افضل السلام تمت بعون الله وحسن توفيقه والله اعلم بالصواب|Physical description: 29-31 lines per page. Written in casual small naskh in black ink, with commented text written in red ink. Light cream paper, glossy, with laid and chain lines and fibers visible. Fol. 1-2 are later replacements (European paper with watermark). Fol. 286 is an added endpaper (European paper with watermark). Table of contents by a later hand on fol. 1b-2a. Inscription in red pencil in Roman script between two lines of the table of contents: "Kemal". Title on the tail of the text block (illegible).|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 162". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥā ʼ 630".|Origin: Copy completed in 833 H. by Shams al-Dīn ibn Ismāʻīl (colophon, fol. 285b).|Three reading statements on the margin of the colophon, dated 922 H., 950H. (or 905H.), the third erased (fol. 285b). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: i, 407, i leaves: paper ; 275 x 185 (200 x 135) mm. bound to 275 x 190 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 4b. The title appears as "Kitāb Sharḥ Majmaʻ Ibn Malak" in an ownership statement on fol. 4a, and as "Sharḥ Majmaʻ al-Baḥrayn" on the tail of the text block.|Incipit: يا من لا يحوط كمال كماله نطاق وصف الفصحاء ولا ينوط بادراك ادراكه افكار فحول الفضلاء نحمدك ... وبعد يقول الضعيف ... عبد اللطيف بن عبد العزيز بن امين الدين ختم الله بالخير عمله ... انّ بعض اخوانى وخلص خلانى فى اثناء الصحبة من البين قالوا ان مجمع البحرين كتاب بديع ... [5أ] ... الحمد لله ابتداء المصنّف فى اول تصنيفه بالتحميد اقتداء بكتاب الله تعالى فى التحميد|Explicit: واجازها محمد حملا لكلامه الى الصرف الى مصالحه تصحيحا له والله اعلم تم الكتاب|Physical description: 27 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings and to overline the commented text. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines, and pulp, visible. Marginal annotations apparently by the same hand as the main text. Fol. 3-39 and 407 are later additions and replacements, on European paper with watermark, written in medium small casual naskh with elements of taʻlīq, with 25 lines per page. Fol. 1-2 apparently more recent addition, with table of contents. Another table of contents appears on fol. 3a-b, and a table of contents mentioning the titles of each Kitāb on fol. 4a. The quires (mainly quinions) have catchwords on the verso of each leaf. Several inscriptions on fol. 406a-b. Three inscriptions mentioning birth dates (1254 H., 1261 H., 1270 H.) on fol. 407a. Foliation in red ink using Arabic numerals.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "... ? thānī 321". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 969".|Origin: Copy completed during the night of Wednesday 10 Dhū al-Qaʻdah 85- ("wa-khamsīn") by Ismaʻīl ibn Maḥmūd al-Qarawī (colophon, fol. 406a).|Two ownership statements on fol. 4a, one in the name of Aḥmad ibn al-ḥājj Bakr(?) al-qāḍī al-Arminālī(?), the other in the name of Muḥammad ʻAlī al-mudarris bi-Jāmiʻ al-Sulṭān Mehmet Fatih Ibn Riḍā Efendi al-ʼRKRī al-qāḍī ibn al-qāḍī ibn al-qāḍī, known as Khwājah zade. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger. Title on tail of text block: "Majmaʻ al-Baḥrayn".|Incipit: يا من لا يحوط كماله كماله يطاق وصف الفصحاء ولا ينوط بادراك ادراكه افكار فحول الفضلاء نحمدك ... وبعد يقول الضعيف ... عبد اللطيف بن عبد العزيز بن امين الدين ختم الله بالخير عمله ... ان بعض اخوانى وخلص خلانى فى اثنا الصحبة من البين قالوا ان مجمع البحرين كتاب بديع ... الحمد لله ابتدا المص فى اول تصنيفه بالتحميد اقتدا بكتاب الله تعالى الحميد|Beginning of original copy (fol. 15b): وهى اصح لان الماء لا يعطى له حكم الاستعمال قبل الانعصال فلا يكون باول الملاقاة|Explicit: واجازها محمد حملا لكلامه اى الصرف الى مصالحه تصحيحا له هذا آخر الكلام الحمد لله على التمام ولرسوله افضل السلام تم الكتاب بعون الله الملك الوهاب|Physical description: 33 lines per page. Written in medium small nash? in black ink with use of red for headings and to overline the commented text. Fol. 1-15 are later additions and replacement, with the beginning of the text on fol. 4b-15a. Fol. 15 is pasted on the recto of an original leaf. On fol. 1a-2a: Table of contents, entitled "Fihrist Majmaʻ al-Baḥrayn ṣāḥibuhu Munlā Ḥusayn ʻalayhi shifāʻāt Sayyid al-kawnayn", fol. 2a). On fol. 2b-3a: Short texts in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish, the first entitled "Duʻāʼ al-nikāḥ". Fol. 3 was pasted on the recto of fol. 4. The two leaves are now separated, revealing a table of contents on fol. 4a. Several inscriptions in Arabic on the pastedown of the upper cover, including short excerpts of various texts.|Inscription in Roman script on a spine label: "A 126" (repeated on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover and in an inscription in pencil in the same place). Several inscriptions on the pastedown of the upper cover: "265 Bl." ( in Western script in pencil) ; "Raqm 765" (in Arabic script, in red pencil). Title in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover (partly wanting; inverted).|Origin: Copy completed in 858 H. by Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, known as Ibn Qarāmān? (colophon, fol. 265b).|Erased impression of a seal in purple ink on fol. 2a. Inscription in Ottoman Turkish after the colophon, dated 1109 H. [1697-8] (fol. 265b). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

Several short excerpts, some attributed to Qādīkhān, on fol. 1a and 5a.|Collation: Paper, fol. i, 124, ii ; i (free endpaper) 14 (European paper) 2-1310 i (later added fly-leaf) i (free endpaper).|Two spine labels (vertical), reading respectively "Kitāb Multaqá al-abḥur" in Arabic script, and "30" in Arabic and Western numerals.|Origin: Copy completed during the night of Thursday 25 Rajab 1106 [March 11, 1695] by Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Ṣamad, former muftī in Balık Sarayı (colophon, fol. 124b).|Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, 1925, from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut).

physical_description: Extent: 73 leaves: paper ; 205 x 155 (122 x 61) mm. bound to 210 x 160 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from inscription on fol. 1a (later hand; red ink).|Physical description: 11 lines per page. Written in black ink with use of red. European paper. The text on the original leaves is framed within a single red line (blue from fol. 52 on). Important ḥāshiyah on the margin and between the lines of the main text. Some leaves are missing (see between fol. 62 and 63). Several leaves are later replacements (see fol. 3, 10, 12). Fol. 1 and 74 are later additions. Table of contents on fol. 2b. Catchword on the verso of the original leaves. Foliation in red ink using Arabic numerals (starts with "1" on fol. 4a). Wear ; a few leaves loose.|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "361 thānī. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on pastedown of the upper cover: "1230/2 Ḥ".|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed in Rabīʻ al-Ākhar 1004 [Dec. 1595 - Jan. 1596] by Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥājjī Ḥasan (fol. 73b in the modern foliation in pencil). Inscription in Ottoman Turkish dated 92 on the margin of the end of the text.|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

author_as_recorded: Rāzī, Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr, active 1261
physical_description: Extent: 76 leaves: paper ; 210 x 148 (135 x 65) mm. bound to 210 x 150 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 75a).|Physical description: 13 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings. European paper ; frame-ruled. Ḥāshiyah on the margin, apparently in the same hand as the main text. Inscriptions, short texts, and impressions of stamps on fol. 1a. Inscriptions in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish and impression of what seems to be a coin with the inscription "Fāṭimah" at its centre, on fol. 75b-76b. Two small pieces of paper placed between fol. 27 and 28, one with annotations and impressions of a stamp, the other being a document in Ottoman Turkish, mentioning the selling of some effects, dated Muḥarram 1223 H. [1808]. Wear on first leaf.|Collation: Paper, fol. 76 ; 1-710 86 ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Origin: According to colophon, copied by Dāwud Ibn Aḥmad al-Asīrī in Ṣafar 1124 [March-April 1712] in Arzan al-Rūm [Erzurum], in the Madrasah Ṣulṭānīyah (fol. 75a).|Circular seal with the figure of goat in purple ink with the inscriptions "335" and "75 Bl." in Roman script on a small piece of paper pasted on fol. 1a. Ownership statement in the name of Aḥmad ibn Muṣṭafá ibn Aḥmad, known as Dīwānī, from Arzan al-Rūm [Erzurum] on fol. 1a, with impression of a stamp. Waqf in the name of al-Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh Adīb (Abdullah Edip), known as Jannatʹzādah (Cennet-zade), qāḍī of Erzurum, dated 1262 H. [1845 or 6], accompanied by his seal, on a piece of paper pasted on fol. 1b. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: i, 245, i leaves: paper ; 290 x 175 (245 x 145) mm. bound to 290 x 190 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from rubric on fol. 1a.|Physical description: Fol. 5-89 and 119-245 written in thick medium small naskh in black ink, with 29 lines per page (250 x 140 mm.), on dark cream paper, hardly translucid, with laid lines and pulp visible. Fol. 4 is a later replacement. According to catchword and foliation in black ink in Arabic numerals, several leaves missing between fol. 4 and 5 (fol. 5 is numbered "12" in the foliation in Arabic numerals). Fol. 58 (65 in the foliation in Arabic) is the beginning of the ninth quire. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including ownership statements and a table of contents. Stained with water, with loss of text.|Label pasted on upper cover with illegible inscription. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 506". (i)a (later added free endpaper), with long note describing the text excerpted from Kashf al-ẓunūn written by the same hand. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: i, 342, ii leaves: paper ; 304 x 210 (210 x 150) mm. bound to 305 x 225 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from illuminated title page (fol. 5a). The title appears in the preamble as "al-Ikhtiyār" (fol. 5b, l. 13).|Physical description: 25 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink, with larger script for headings; use of red for re-inking and text-stops. Illuminated title page (ʻunwān). Dark cream paper, glossy, with laid and chain lines visible. Marginal annotations. Fol. 1-4 are later additions (European paper with watermark, "Tre Lune"), with inscriptions on fol. 1a, and a table of contents on fol. 2b-3b. Foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals (starts with "1" on fol. 6a, the first fol. of the text after the title page).|Illuminated title page executed in gold and blue, green, and red (fol. 5a): Panel divided in three parts, with an upper panel mentioning the title, a central lobed roundel with the statement of responsibility, and a lower panel with the name of the patron. Small roundel on the left margin of the upper part of the panel.|Patronage: Copied for (bi-rasm) Taqī al-Dīn Abū al-Barakāt Muḥammad ibn al-Rūmī al-Ḥanafī (illuminated title page, fol. 5a).|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on 25 or 15 Rabīʻ al-Awwal 758 [March 1357] by Sulayman, known as Abū al-Rabīʻ (fol. 341b).|From the books of al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Jalīl, 1143 H. (fol. 1a, with impression of two seals). Acquired by Robert Garrett from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut), 1925.

subject_as_recorded: Ustarūshanī, Muḥammad ibn Maḥmūd, -1234 or 1235. Fuṣūl|Marghinānī, ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Abī Bakr, active 13th century. Fuṣūl al-iḥkām fī uṣūl al-aḥkām|Islamic law--15th century|Hanafites--15th century|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
physical_description: Extent: 432 leaves: paper ; 243 x 150 (155 x 95) mm. bound to 243 x 165 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from preamble of text (fol. 11b, l. 15).|Physical description: 23 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Thin light biscuit paper, glossy, with laid lines visible. The text has been collated. Fol. 411-427 and 430 are later replacements or additions on European paper with watermark (grapes). Fol. 1-8 and 431-432 are later added fly-leaves (European paper with watermark), some with inscriptions (fol. 1a and 2b). Fol. 9-10 are later additions on another type of European paper. Table of contents on fol. 9a. Key to abbreviations used in the text on fol. 10b-11a. A piece of paper with inscriptions is placed at the beginning of the volume. Quaternions; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals (starts with 1 on fol. 11a).|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on Monday 5 Ramaḍān 899 [June, 9, 1494] by Ḥabīb Allāh ibn Maḥmūd ibn Yaḥyá(?) ibn Maḥmūd al-Ḥājj al-Hāshimī ; rubrication completed on 12 Ramāḍan (fol. 429b). Collation statement dated 9 Shawwāl 1171 [June 16, 1758] by Muḥammad Jamīl Ibn al-marḥūm Munlā ʻAbd al-Jalīl on the margin of the colophon (fol. 429b).|Several ownership statements on fol. 10a, in the name of al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Ghafūr, muftī in Karkūk (dated 1190 H.) ; of Muḥammad Ṣāliḥ ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥusayn al-khaṭīb bi-Dānyāl al-Nabī, who bought the volume from Muḥammad Efendi ibn Ibrāhīm Efendi (dated Ramaḍān 1275, with impression of a seal reading: "al-Sayyid Muḥammad Ṣāliḥ 71"), followed by names of persons who read the book. Impression of a seal on fol. 11a and on fol. 11b. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 275 leaves: paper ; 209 x 142 (136 x 85) mm. bound to 209 x 145 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from illuminated title page (fol. 1a; the same title appears in the colophon, fol. 272a). The second part of the title, mentioning the author's name, is hardly legible.|Physical description: 27 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red (gold and gold text-stops on fol. 1b). Illuminated title page (fol. 1a). Illuminated headpiece with the basmalah (fol. 1b). European paper with watermark; a few quires of darker paper with fibers visible on the surface; glossy. Fol. 273 is a later added endpaper with inscriptions (legal decision by Muḥammad al-faqīr al-Kawākibī, muftī in Aleppo, and al-Marghinānī, as used by Jawī Zādah and Bustān Zādah; inverted). Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Some qires are numbered in red ink using Arabic numerals. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits the first folio).|Illuminated title page (ʻunwān, fol. 1a) with a panel divided in two parts: the upper part occupied the upper third of the panel and consists of a cartouche in gold, black, red, and blue, with the title; the lower part consists of a central roundel in gold, black, and blue, with the name of the author, on a ground left blank; the blue outline extents on the vertical and horizontal axis and connects to a frame with corner pieces with a floral motif. The panel is outlined in blue. Left portion of the leaf wanting.|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on Sunday 10 Rabīʻ al-Ākhar 973 [Nov. 4, 1565] (fol. 272a).|Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

[1748] by Ḥusayn ibn ʻUmar ibn Ibrāhīm al-Dabbāghī al-mansūb bi-On īkī Dīwānī, in Qusṭanṭinīyah, in the madrasat al-sulṭān Muḥammad Khān (fol. 182a).|Copyist: Ḥusayn ibn ʻUmar ibn Ibrāhīm al-Dabbāghī.|Impression of a seal on fol.Ea. author_as_recorded: Maḥbūbī, ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Masʻūd, -1346 or 1347
physical_description: Extent: 227 leaves: paper ; 205 x 138 (145 x 75) mm. bound to 208 x 145 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 2a, in red ink).|Physical description: 19 lines per page. Written in a casual medium small naskh with elements of nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red to overline the commented text; scarce use of dots. Script and paper different for fol.2-23, written in a careful thick naskh with elements of nastaʻlīq, in black ink with use of red (122 x 62 mm.). European papers with watermark. A repair in paper covers part of fol. 2a. Table of contents on fol.1a-b. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including ownership statements, a collation statement, verses of poetry in Persian. Marginal and interlinear annotations on the beginning of the text. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Title on tail of text block.|Inscription in Arabic script in red pencil on the pastedown of upper cover: "Raqm 206 ʻ".|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on a Wednesday ("yawm chahār shambah") in 1035 H. [1625 or 6] (perhaps the numbers should be read 1635) H. in Balad Āwarnah [Āvarneh?] (fol. 225). Read and collated by Ibrāhīm ibn al-Ḥājj Bakr in Balad Āwarnah on 2 Jumādá al-Ākhar 1043H. [1633] (fol. 225b).|Reading and collation statement on fol. 1a, mentioning that the text was collated on a good copy by Ibrāhīm Ibn al-Ḥājj Bakr (with erased seal; it is unclear whether the copy or the collation is by Ibrāhīm; see also collation note on fol. 225b, mentioned above in the note on origin). Inscription on fol. 1a mentioning the name "Rafīq Manṣūr Najdī Shiyāb (or Thiyāb)". Several ownership statements, some with impression of a seal, on fol. 2a, in the name of Maʻtūq(?) ibn ʻAlī (dated 1118 H.); of ʻAbd al-Ḥayy Ibn al-darwīsh ʻAlī; of ʻAbd al-Razzāq Ibn Mahdānī (dated '680 H.); of ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Arhamī(?) Imām Zādah. Impression of a seal on fol. 225a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

I / A264a".|Origin: According to colophon, copied by Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar ibn Ismāʻīl, who completed his work on Friday 7 Ramaḍān 683 [Nov. 17, 1284] (fol. 257b). Reading statement on fol. 257b, mentioning that this part was read under al-Shaykh Muṣṭafá al-Ayyūbī in 1166-1167 H. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Khabbāzī, ʻUmar ibn Muḥammad, 1231 or 1232-1292. Mughnī fī uṣūl al-fiqh|Islamic law--Interpretation and construction--History--13th century--Sources|Islamic law--Interpretation and construction--History--14th century--Sources|Hanafites|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
physical_description: Extent: 247 leaves : paper ; 267 x 184 (150 x 95) mm. bound to 265 x 185 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from tail of text block.|Physical description: 12 and 27 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh(?) in black ink with use of red. Thick paper, glossy, hardly translucid, with a few chain lines visible ; some leaves of European paper with watermark (particularly in first part). Gloss on the margin and between the lines of the main text. Note mentioning a price on fol. 1a. Kabīkaj, short texts, and inscriptions on fol. 140a.|Chiefly quaternions in first part ; quinions in the second part ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Inscription in Arabic numerals on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "40".|Two impressions of an oval stamp on fol. 49a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

title_as_recorded: Khulāṣat al-fatāwá ... al-mansūb taʾlīfuhā ilá al-ṣadr al-shahīd Ḥusām al-Dīn ...
title_as_recorded_agr: خلاصة الفتاوى ... المنسوب تأليفها الى الصدر الشهيد حسام الدين ...
subject_as_recorded: Fatwas--History--12th century--Sources|Hanafites|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton|Hanafites|Manuscrits arabes--New Jersey--Princeton|Fatwas|Hanafites|Manuscripts, Arabic|New Jersey--Princeton|1100-1199
physical_description: Extent: 382 leaves: paper ; 310 x 208 (195 x 125) mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 3a).|Physical description: 33 lines per page. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red. The text is vocalized. Yāʾ for alif maqṣūrah ; final yāʾ dotted. Marginal annotations (gloss and collation notes). European paper. Table of contents on fol. 2a. Short excerpts on legal matters written by the same hand as the main text on fol. 381b-382b Worm-eaten; disbound ; fragile|Chiefly quinions ; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Some quires towards the end of the volume are numbered using Arabic ordinals (see fol. 253a).|Origin: According to colophon, copied by Muḥammad ibn Sallāmah al-Abshīhī(?) al-Shāfiʻī, Thursday 21 (or 11) Shawwāl 990 [Nov. 18, 1582] (fol. 380b).|Ownership statement dated al-Qāhirah, 990(?) H. on fol. 380b (partly wanting due to worm damage). Ownership with seal on fol. 3a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

subject_as_recorded: Hanafites--Early works to 1800|Islamic law--Early works to 1800
physical_description: Extent: 142 leaves : paper ; 212 x 153 (167 x 100) mm. bound to 210 x 153 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Physical description: 17 lines per page; written in naskhi script in black on white paper. Rubrication and catchwords; text ruled in red. Fol. 1-5, 8 blank. Fol. 6 may be from a different work, as it is written with a different hand and is not ruled. Judging from the foliation, leaves 1-20, 22-27 from the original are missing. Fol. 100-107 are bound upside-down. Extensive water damage but text is still legible. Fol. 7 is repaired with some loss of text.

author_as_recorded: Marghīnānī, ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr, -1196 or 1197
author_as_recorded_agr: مرغيناني، علي بن ابي بكر، -1196 or 1197
note: ff. 193. 208 x 145 (171 x 100) mm. bound to 208 x 151 mm. 23 lin. Dhū al-Ḥijjah 108-(?), Ḥasan ibn al-Sayyid Jān al-Qaraḥiṣārī.|Title from text (fol. 2a)|Marginal notes. Table of contents. Kabīkaj (invocation against bookworms) on fol. 1a.|Identical with Berlin 4845 (Fatāwá al-nawāzil, attributed to al-Samarqandī) and with Mukhtārāt al-nawāzil, usually ascribed to ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr al-Marghīnānī (d. 593/1197) - for the latter title cf. Brockelmann, GAL, I, 469 (II); S I, 649; Bank. XIX/1, no. 1673; Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻarabīyah (1887-1892/3), III, 126 (anon.); Fihris al-kutub al-mawjūdah bi-al-Maktabah al-Azharīyah, II, 257. As already noticed by Ahlwardt, the Kitāb al-nawāzil of al-Samarqandī described by Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn, (s.v. al-Nawāzil fī al-furūʻ, col. 1981) represents an entirely different work - for mss. of the latter cf. Brockelmann, GAL, I, 210 (no. 3); S I, 347; Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻarabīyah (1887-1892/3), III, 144; Fihris al-kutub al-mawjūdah bi-al-Maktabah al-Azharīyah, II, 291.

note: ff. 259. 198 x 124; 149 x 60 mm. 21 lin. Shaʻbān 1084.|According to notes on fol. la, as well as Fihris al-kutub al-mawjūdah bi-al-Maktabah al-Azharīyah, II, 287 (2 copies), the author is ʻAlī ibn ḥusayn ibn Muḥammad al-Sughdī, d. 461/1068 or 9; the ms. Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻarabīyah (1887-1892/3), III, 142 (with identical incipit), bears the title al-Nutaf al-ḥisān fī al-fatāwá and is attributed, together with the other mss. listed in Brockelmann, GAL, II, 254 (8) and S II, 270 to al-Qāsim ibn al-ḥusayn al-Damrāghī al-Ghaznawī (d. 854/1459); ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn, col. 1925 and the mss. Paris 6750 (cf. Brockelmann, GAL, S I, 657, 47b) and Mossul (Brockelmann, GAL, S II, 951, 34) attribute this work to Abū Bakr al-Wāsiṭī.|Incip.: ... الحمد لله رب العالمىن والعاقبة للمتقىن ولا عدوان الا على الظالمىن ... کتاب الىاه . اعلم ارشدك الله ان الماء على وجهىن

subject_as_recorded: Islamic law--Early works to 1800|Hanafites--Early works to 1800

note: ff. 49. 167 x 122; 128 x 90 mm. 15 lin. 15th cen.|According to note on fol. 11b, this is an abridgment, by Qāḍī al-Quḍāh Khayr al-Dīn Khalīl, of the work on shurūṭ (Ghurar al-shurūṭ wa-durar al-sumūṭ ? cf. Brockelmann, GAL, S I, 638, 5a) of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Rīghdhamūnī, d. 493/1110.|Incip. (fol. 1b): ... القسم الثالث فى بىان الخلل فىها بالعلل الدقاىق . بسم الله ... سجل دعوى وکىل المدعى على وکىل|fol. 11b: ... القسم الرابع فى رسوم الحکام وکتاب القاضى والسجلات والمناشىر|Explicit: ... وقد ذکرنا ساىر التعرىفات فى قسم الشروط وما ىتعلق بکتاب القاضى الى القاضى ومن طلبها وجد فىه ان شاء الله العزىز الوهاب ...

note: ff. 161. 204 x 145; 143 x 65 mm. 21 lin. Salonica, Shawwāl 1109.|Abridgment of his Majmaʻ al-fatāwá: Brockelmann, GAL, I, 461 (8: no. 1); S I, 639.|Incip.: ... احمد الله حمدا بعد ما اظهرمن معدن

subject_as_recorded: Hanafites--Early works to 1800|Islamic law--Early works to 1800|Fatwas--Early works to 1800
author_as_recorded: Ṣadr al-Shahīd, ʻUmar ibn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz, 1090 or 1091-1141
note: ff. 67. 175 x 130; 120 x 69 mm. 15 lin. 15th/16th cen.|Identical with the mss. Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻarabīyah (1887-1892/3), III, 81, Buhar 153, British Museum Supplement 278, and Fihris al-kutub al-mawjūdah bi-al-Maktabah al-Azharīyah, II, 209, listed as Umdat al-muftī waʼ-mustaftī of Ibn Māzah, d. 536/1141 (Brockelmann, GAL, I, 462, 10: no. 3; S I, 640); the same text is found also in ms. Hitti, Garrett collection no. 1687 [shelf no. Islamic Manuscripts, Garrett no. 150B] (with title al-Fatāwī al-ṣughrá on title page by a later hand). On the other hand, the ms. Berlin 4812 ('ʻUmdat al-fatāwá) contains an entirely different work, apparently identical with that described by Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn, s.v. ʻUmdat al-fatāwá (IV, 262, no. 8330).|The mss. Gotha 1041 and Bologna 196/7 (listed in Brockelmann, GAL, S I, 644, lin. 9) as well as Vatican 477 (2) and Garrett no. 4179Y of the present collection (margin of fol. 1b, later hand) bear the title al-Nuqāyah (the authorʼs name does not appear) - this would suggest that our text is identical with the Nuqāyah described by Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn, col. 1971 (VI, 373, no. 13951 Flügel); according to Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn, this work was also known under the titles al-ʻUmdah, al-Nuqāyah al-ṣughrá, al-Nuqāyah fī ʻilm al-hidāyah, and Nuqāyat Qāḍī Khān.|Incip.: ... الحمد لله ... باب ما ىجوز به الوضوء وما لا ىجوز الماء الجارى ىجوز الاغتسال

subject_as_recorded: Fatwas--Early works to 1800|Hanafites--Early works to 1800
note: Three different titles appear on the bottom edges of three copies: Majmaʻ al-fatāwá in this copy, Fuṣūl al-Ustrūshanī in Garrett no. 2402Yq, and Fatāwá Samarqandī in Garrett no. 5806Yq; the fourth Princeton copy (Garrett no. 864H, cf. Brockelmann, GAL, II, 406, 9, no. 2) is listed in Hittiʼs catalogue as Majmaʻ al-fatāwā by Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-ḥānūtī, d. 1010/1601-2 (the title and authorʼs name by a later hand on fol. 1a; the ms. is undoubtedly older than the catalogue indicates, apparently of the 15th cent.). This is evidently incorrect, since this copy is dated 861 H., and in faṣl al-takhāruj of Kitāb al-farāʼid (fol. 206a, lin. 7) the anon. author quotes his teacher ḥamīd al-Dīn [ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Rāmushī al-Bukhārī] d. 667/1268-9 (Laknawī, al-Fawāʼid al-bahīyah, p. 125). The text contains numerous passages in Persian and is probably identical with the mss. Cairo2 I, p. 460 (anon.), Brockelmann, GAL, S II, 316 (6c: attributed to Aḥmad ibn Abī Bakr al-ḥanafī) and Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi Kütüphanesi Arapc̦a yazmalar kataloğu, 3536-3540.|ff. 207. 267 x 177; 210 x 125 mm. 25 lin. Ramaḍān 861.|Incip.: ... کتاب الطهارة. مسائل هذا الکتاب مشتملة على سبعة فصول

(October-November 1711) (fol. 151a).|Acquired from Widgery, Cambridge, A.D. 1925.

physical_description: Extent: xviii, 206 leaves : paper ; 320 x 210 (237 x 127) mm bound to 318 x 216 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from preface (fol. 3a).|Index of all the names mentioned in the text (fol. i b-xviii b). After the colophon is what is evidently the colophon of the copy from which MS was made. It is dated 871 [1466] and was transcribed by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Nuwayrī. The author is dependent on Quṭb al-Dīn al-Ḥalabī, 735 [1334/5] and al-Bukhārī 194-256 [810-870].|Collation: Paper ; fol. i + xviii + 206 + i ; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 27 lines per page ; frame-ruled in red.|Description: Rubricated ; some vowel signs ; watermarks (shield with a face-in-the-moon, roman-alphabet letters "AG") ; MS in excellent condition.|Origin: According to colophon copy completed Wednesday 8 Shaʻbān 1274 by Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Jazāyirī (fol. 206b).|Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1900.

note: Copied A.H. 854 (?) [A.D. 1450] by Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Jarjamūsī [?] al-Muʼadhdhin.|Fols. 42; 25.8 x 17 cm.; written surface 19 x 12.5 cm.; 21 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with few vowel signs; entries in red.|A small collection of judicial decisions according to the Ḥanafite school of law and jurisprudence.|Beg.: بسم الله ... الماء الجاري ىجوز الاغتسال فىه والوضوء|Colophon:[نجزالکتاب بحمد الله وعونه وحسن توفىقه على ىد اضعف عباد الله واحوجهم الى رحمته احمد بن علي الجرجموسي [؟] المؤذن عفى [عفا] الله عنه داعىا لمالکه بطول البقاء غفرالله له ولمن قرأ فىه ودعا لمالکه ولکاتبه ولجمىع المسلمىن امىن . سألتك بالله الذي خضعت * له السموات فهو الواحد الباري * اذا تصفحته استغفر لکاتبه * لعل کاتبه ىنجو من الناري * بتارىخ ثامن شهر رمضان المعظم قدره سنة اربع وخمسىن وثمانمائة[؟|Marginal notes and glosses. Important words are overlined. Title and name of author are given by a later hand. Name of author is also given by a later hand as ʻUmar Abū Ḥafṣ al-Qūnawī. MS in good condition but mended; modern Arabic binding. Very rare.|Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), IV, p. 359; cf. Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻArabīyah al-maḥfūẓah bi-al-Kutubkhānah al-Khudaywīyah, III, p. 81; Rieu, Supplement of the catalogue of the Arabic Mss, 278.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from lower edge of text block.|Marginal notes and glosses. Volume 1 has a table of contents (fol. [i]b-[ii]a) and extracts (fol. 1a). Inscriptions after the colophon and on the verso (v. 1, fol. 255a-b). Collection of masāʼil (vol. 2, fol. 329b).|Collation: Paper ; vol. 1: fol. ii (later paper) + 255, vol.2: 329 (fol. 2 is later paper) ; catchwords ; foliation in ink using Hindu-Arabic numerals; modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals.|Layout: 25-29 lines per page.|Description: Rubricated (vol. 2 only) ; some vowel signs ; MS in good condition.|Origin: [Volume 1] Copy completed 24 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 885 by Aḥmad ibn Pīrmazīd (v. 1, fol. 255a) -- [Volume 2] Copy completed Sunday 21 Ramaḍān 786 by Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf ibn ʻAlī, known as Ibn Ṣalāḥ al-Suʻūdī (v. 2, fol. 328a).|Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1900.

note: Written A.H. 883 [A.D. 1478] by the author.|Fols. 330; 29.5 x 17.8 cm.; written surface 20 x 9.9 cm.; 27 lines to page; glazed Arabic paper; in Fārisi; with vowel signs; with catchwords; entries in red.|A commentary on Ghurar al-aḥkām, the authorʼs own work on Ḥanafite law.|Beg.: بسم الله ... الحمد لله الذي احکم احکام الشرع|Colophon: وقد وقع الفراغ من تألىفه ىوم السبت الثاني عشر من جمادى الاولى لسنة ثلث وثمانىن وثمان ومائة وقد کان البدء في ىوم السبت الثاني عشر من ذي القعدة لسنة سبع وسبعىن وثمان مائة عن ىد اضعف عباد الله تعالى واحوجهم الى رحمته مؤلف الکتاب محمد بن فرامرز بن علي عاملهم الله تعالى بلطفه الخفي والجلي. الحمد لله على التوفىق. تم الکتاب بعون الله تعالى الملك الوهاب والىه المرجع والمآب. الله تعالى اعلم بالصواب تم|Marginal and interlinear notes and glosses. Ruled marginal lines in red. Stated in colophon that work was composed A.H. 877-883 [A.D. 1473-1478]. On title page and two preceding folios is a table of contents. MS in good condition but stained with dampness; Arabic leather binding; blind stamped and tooling.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.|Suyūṭī, Naẓm al-ʻIqyān (1927), p. 109; Hājji Khalīfah IV, pp. 312-15; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 4797/8.|Printed in Cairo, A.H. 1294; Constantinople, A.H. 1329.

MS in good condition; Arabic leather binding.|Probably from the XVIIth century.|Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1904.

subject_as_recorded: Suyūṭī, 1445-1505. Nuqāyah|Classification of sciences|Islamic law--Early works to 1800|Hanafites--Early works to 1800|Qiblah--Early works to 1800|Timekeeping--Early works to 1800
note: Fols. 143; 20.2 x 14.6 cm.; written surface 16 x 10 cm.; 25 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. Itmām al-dirāyah li-qurrāʼ al-Nuqāyah, by al-Suyūṭī, a commentary on the authorʼs own work al-Nuqāyah. Copy made in A.H. 981 [A.D. 1573].|2. Kitāb al-Hidāyah min al-ḍalālah fī maʻrifat al-waqt wa-al-qiblah min ghayr ālah, a work on determining time of prayer and direction of the qiblah without the aid of an instrument, by Shihāb al-Dīn al-Qalyūbī, A.H. 1069 [A.D. 1658/9]. See Khulāṣat al-Athar I, p. 175; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5706. Copy probably from XVIIIth century.|3. al-Fawākih al-Badrīyah, a work on legal theory by Badr al-Dīn Abū al-Yusr Muḥammad ibn al-Ghars, A.H. 932 [A.D. 1525/6]. See ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), IV, pp. 467/8; cf. Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 4807. The copy was made A.H. 973 [A.D. 1565].|MS in fair condition; Arabic binding.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

Risālah fī ʻalāmāt al-sāʻah, by Ibn al-Wardī, an eschatological treatise on the signs of the last day, being a section of the treatise on cosmography, Kharīdat al-ʻajāʼib wa-farīdat al-gharāʼib.|Copied A.H. 1114 [A.D. 1702/3].|Fols. 105; 21 x 15.6 cm.; written surface 16 x 9.6 cm.; 27 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in naskhi; with few vowel signs; with catchwords; entries in red.|The author concludes his work with Qilādat al-durr al-manthūr fī dhikr al-baʻth wa-al-nushūr, a poem on the last day by ʻIzz al-Dīn ʻAbd al-ʻAzīz ibn Aḥmad ibn Saʻīd al-Damīrī al-Dīrīnī, A.H. 694 [A.D. 1294/5]. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 2748/9.|3. Sharḥ ʻalá Jihat al-waḥdah, a commentary on Jihat al-waḥdah, which is a commentary on a statement in the preface of al-Fawāʼid al-Fanārīyah which runs as follows: ... اعلم ان من حق کل طالب کثرة تضبطها جهة وحدة ان ىعرفها بتلك الجهة وىحصل الشعور بها قبل الشروع فىها حتى ىأمن من فوات شىء مما ىعنىه وصرف الهمة الى ما لا ىعنىه|Fols. 16; 21 x 15.5 cm.; written surface 15.5 x 9 cm.; 17 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in naskhi; with catchwords.|Marginal and interlinear notes and glosses. The name of the copyist appears in the colophon as Aḥmad ibn Muṣṭafá.|4. Rūḥ al-shurūḥ, a commentary on al-Farāʼiḍ al-Sirājīyah.|Copied A.H. 1118 [A.D. 1706] by Muṣṭafá ibn ʻAbd al-Ḥalīm.|Fols. 96; 21 x 15.6 cm.; written surface 16 x 11.7 cm.; 24-27 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in naskhi; with catchwords.|Marginal notes and glosses; text is overlined in red. MS in good condition but stained with dampness; Arabic leather binding with flap; color stamped and blind tooling on cover and flap.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

physical_description: Extent: 174 leaves : paper ; 212 x 252 (173 x 95) mm. bound to 207 x 151 mm.
note: Incipit (like Berlin 4845): ... الحمد لله ... کتاب الطهارة . الطهارة فى اللغة عبارة عن النظافة وفى الشرىعة عبارة عن غسل اعضاء مخصومة|Ms. codex.|Table of contents (folios Bb-Db)|Identical with Berlin 4845 (Fatāwá al-nawāzil, attributed to al-Samarqandī) and with Mukhtārāt al-nawāzil, usually ascribed to ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr al-Marghīnānī (d. 593/1197) - for the latter title cf. Brockelmann, GAL, I, 469 (II); S I, 649; Bank. XIX/1, no. 1673; Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻarabīyah (1887-1892/3), III, 126 (anon.); Fihris al-kutub al-mawjūdah bi-al-Maktabah al-Azharīyah, II, 257. As already noticed by Ahlwardt, the Kitāb al-nawāzil of al-Samarqandī described by ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn, (s.v. al-Nawāzil fī al-furūʻ, col. 1981) represents an entirely different work - for mss. of the latter cf. Brockelmann, GAL, I, 210 (no. 3); S I, 347; Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻarabīyah (1887-1892/3), III, 144; Fihris al-kutub al-mawjūdah bi-al-Maktabah al-Azharīyah, II, 291.
